there are a variety of tools available
to accelerate migrations and the key is
to understanding what tools fit where
and suit what type of migrations here
are just a few tools that AWS offers one
major tool for bringing windows into AWS
includes the vm import/export tool the
vm import/export enables you to easily
import virtual machine images from your
existing environment to aid Amazon ec2
instances as well as export them back to
your on-premise environment for your
existing on-premise databases we have
the AWS database migration service which
helps you to migrate databases to AWS
easily and securely the source database
remains fully operational during the
migration minimizing downtime to
applications that rely on the database
the AWS database migration service can
migrate your data to and from most
widely used
mercial and open-source databases we
also have the AWS management pack for
Microsoft System Center enabling you to
view and monitor your AWS resources
directly in the operations manager
console in this way you can use a single
familiar console to monitor all of your
resources whether they are on-premise or
in the AWS cloud you get a consolidated
view of all of your AWS resources across
regions and availability zones it also
has built-in integration with Amazon
Cloud Watch so that the metrics and
alarms defined in cloud watch appear as
performance counters and alerts in
operations manager finally we also have
AWS Systems Manager for Microsoft System
Center Virtual Machine Manager which
lets you administer your AWS resources
using s CBMM you can monitor and manage
your ec2 for Windows instances in the
AWS cloud as well as on-premise virtual
machines from the system center console
you can also perform common maintenance
tasks such as creating restarting
stopping and removing instances as well
as remotely accessing an instance using
remote desktop protocol there are two
major types of license options for
Windows on AWS the first is to use
licenses provided by AWS these license
included instances allow you to access a
fully compliant microsoft software
license bundled with Amazon ec2 or
Amazon relational database service or
RDS instances with the license included
model you pay for licenses as you go
with no upfront cost or long term
investments you can choose from Amazon
machine images with Microsoft Windows
Server or with both Windows Server and
Microsoft sequel server pre-installed
Amazon RDS for sequel server offers
databases without the time-consuming

option means that AWS
licensing compliance this option offers

also with this option Windows Server
client access licenses or Cal's
are not required if you've already

this allows you to take advantage of the
